result.execSummary:
The defendant Marjorie J Hendricks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:04 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Curtis Julka.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Julka - will enter a plea to counts 1 & 2 on 2014CF117 and count 2 on 2014CF93.  DA concurs.  Atty Julka concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 2, and strikes the enhancers on each count on 2014CF117 & finds the defendant guilty on count 2 on 2014CF93 and orders count 1 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Julka.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2014CF93 (Count 2)

-30 days county jail, with huber and to commence within 60 days.
-Court costs - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

2014CF117 (counts 1 & 2)

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS (each count)

-Court costs.
-AODA assessment
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-CT 1 - 90 days of county jail, concurrent to any other sentence and with huber and to commence within 60 days.

Court grants the defendant 2 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 10:19 a.m.
Defendant's Pre-trial Motions and Requests for Orders

Court sets for Status Hearing on December 7, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.  All motions and witness lists be filed by December 1, 2015.

Court will set for plea & sentencing on October 13, 2015 at 3:15 p.m.

Court adjourned at 9:51 a.m.

Court will set for status in 2 weeks.  Statement by the Court - will sign the motion and order.  Statement by the defendant.  Court informs the defendant to contact the JA by friday to schedule something on this case.  Defendant requests her Discovery.

Court will set for plea & sentencing on June 1, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:12 a.m.
Status hearing on March 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

1:44 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Selsing - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing on each case.  Defendant concurs.  

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives her right to a preliminary examination on each case.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim on each case and binds the defendant over for trial on each case.  

State files informations with the court.  Attorney Selsing and defendant acknowledge receipt of the informations and waives any reading.  Atty Selsing enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Status Hearing in 30 days - March 9, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:48 p.m.
Waiver of Prelim on January 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

1:08 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Court questions defendant regarding address and employment.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $250.00 cash bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Benjamin A. or Christopher P.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status of Counsel in approx 2 weeks.

Court adjourned at 1:12 p.m.
